Name: mandarin production | mandarin | EN15804GD, U
Category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0123:Growing of citrus fruits
Description: This datasets represents the growing of mandarin inSouth Africa, high density planting (1600 tree/ha). This configuration would have a potential yield of 75 ton/ha, an average yield of 45 ton/ha, a conservative yield of 35 ton/ha. The dataset represent the production over a year of 1 kg of mandarin. For the year of reference a yield of 53,48 ton/ha has been produced. The data came from Commercial Enterprise Budget (Combuds) for mandarin cultivation from the Western Cape Department of Agriculture. Mandarin growing areas in South Africa are: Western Cape (42%), Eastern Cape (31%) and Limpopo (20%), with some minor production in Mpumalanga (4%). The dataset represent the WC province, althought the citrus farming practices are quite standardised throughout the country.
